intro: Astartea fascicularis var. brachyphylla, commonly known as the short-stemmed starwort, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the temperate regions of North America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants commonly known as buckwheats and sorrels. The plant features slender, often branched stems that are covered in small, translucent, waxy leaves. Its flowers are small and clustered in dense, spike-like inflorescences, typically appearing in shades of pink or white. This variant is distinguished by its shorter stems and compact growth habit compared to other varieties of Astartea fascicularis.
